content: Noncomputable def means that Lean cannot generate bytecode for that definition (in this case because it depends on the axiom of choice). If the sum doesn't exist, the result is 0, but determining whether the sum exists is, in general, noncomputable. You can still prove things about your definition.
If you don't want to worry about which definitions are bytecode-computable or not, you can put noncomputable theory after your imports.
Thanks for explaining that and for all the help
Matthew Honnor has marked this topic as resolved.
